New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 42nd home run
Colton Cowser is the 10th rookie in team history to hit 20 homers in a season
Key Match Events: Dodgers survived an 0-for-5 outing by Shohei Ohtani
Orioles closed to 5-3 in the fifth on Colton Cowser's three-run shot
Dodgers loaded the bases in the eighth and Tommy Edman's sacrifice fly with two outs extended their lead to 6-3
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said: 'Playing against teams that are in pennant races we showed well.'
Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said: 'It's a tough lineup to pitch against, a tough team to punch out.'
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said: 'Guys are understanding this is the time to lock it in and they're doing so.'
Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said: 'There was some soft contact in there that kind of led to a couple runs, but I thought we did a nice job out of the bullpen.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers went 7-2 on their nine-game homestand against Seattle, Tampa Bay and Baltimore.
The Dodgers stretched their NL West lead to four games after Arizona and San Diego lost and are the first team in baseball to win 80 games.
Others: Bobby Miller gave up two hits in five strong innings.
Evan Phillips pitched the ninth to earn his 17th save.
